title: Why does my Android phone suddenly play music from Google Play? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most phones will detect when you plug in headphones, and a common setting is to start a music player. Plugging in also disconnects the speaker(s)So, chances are you've got Google Music set up to run when headphones are plugged in, and the music will play. If your headphone socket is damaged, or simply dirty switches, then your phone might think headphones are being plugged in and thus starts playing music. if you can't clean the socket, you might simply end up disabling the headphone insertion auto-run feature.
Clear all data for Google Play Music and any other Google Play app then set them up again.
